definition[0]: to think about something that you might do in the future
definition[1]: to accept the possibility that something is true
example[2]: The thought that she might be dead was too terrible to contemplate.
definition[2]: to think about something seriously for a period of time
note[2]: contemplate your navel (=think so much about your own life that you do not notice other important things â€“ used humorously)
example[3]: Jack went on vacation to contemplate his future.
example[4]: She sat down and contemplated what she had done.
definition[3]: to look at someone or something for a period of time in a way that shows you are thinking
example[5]: He contemplated her with a faint smile.
